A **katana** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a one-handed weapon that uses the [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"). It is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as a **samurai sword** when unidentified.

A [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai") wielding a katana has a chance of performing a [shattering blow](/wiki/Shattering_blow "Shattering blow"), destroying a monster's wielded weapon.

The katana is the [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") for the [artifact](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") [Snickersnee](/wiki/Snickersnee "Snickersnee").

## Generation

All Samurai start the game with a +0 katana.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

1⁄250 of all randomly generated weapons will be katana.

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have a 1⁄290 chance of being generated with a katana as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai_\(player_monster\) "Samurai (player monster)") have a 1⁄2 chance of forcing a katana in place of their initial weapon.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As part of [commit 20cbadcf](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/20cbadcf85544cf9d0c3f4e4200b2800bab49c8e) - which strengthens [quest leaders](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader") and makes it so that killing them no longer makes the game [unwinnable](/wiki/Unwinnable "Unwinnable") - the [Samurai quest](/wiki/Samurai_quest "Samurai quest") leader [Lord Sato](/wiki/Lord_Sato "Lord Sato") generates with a +4 katana.

## Strategy

The primary differences between a katana and a long sword are the +1 bonus to hit, the katana's d10 damage to small monsters (as opposed to d8 for a long sword), and the inability to convert a katana into [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur") by [dipping](/wiki/Dip "Dip"). The katana is also the most damaging non-artifact weapon to use the long sword weapon skill, and is often sought after as an off-hand weapon for [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") combat.

### Average damage calculation

The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from [weapon skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), or from using a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") weapon against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") or [demons](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON").

| Weapon    | Small monsters                                                                           | Large monsters                                                                           |
| --------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| +7 katana | ![\frac{1+10}{2}+7=\bold{12.5}](/images/math/5/7/d/57d523a837be0ff4056842444fe46a91.png) | ![\frac{1+12}{2}+7=\bold{13.5}](/images/math/4/8/8/4882ad39b5573c014a1c1b0c2eb9fd1e.png) |

## History

The katana first appears in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d"). From this version to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e"), the now-[defunct](/wiki/Defunct "Defunct") [Ninja](/wiki/Ninja_\(role\) "Ninja (role)") role starts with a katana.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

In [NetHack 2.2a](/wiki/NetHack_2.2a "NetHack 2.2a") and 2.3e, Snickersnee can be created by [naming](/wiki/Naming "Naming") any katana.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Katana](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katana "wikipedia:Katana")***

The *katana* is the name used for a Japanese sword characterized by a curved, single-edged blade with a circular or squared guard and a long grip to accommodate two hands. The term originates in the early 8th century CE and refers to single-edged swords in general, with the ones used by lower-ranking samurai and the like known as *uchigatana* (打刀). Despite the katana's modern reputation as a superb weapon, it was reserved for close combat, and only became commonplace as a weapon during the portion of the 16th-century Sengoku period where tactics changed and began to favor group battles by large groups of mobilized foot soldiers - the quality of [steel](/wiki/Steel "Steel") in Japan was also relatively poor at the time of the katana's initial exportation.

The statline for the katana, including the +1 to-hit bonus, is derived from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*.

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), the katana gains a 50% [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength")-based bonus to odamage when wielded without a shield or offhand weapon.

[Maids](/wiki/Maid "Maid") have a 1⁄4 chance of generating with a katana if the player character is a Samurai, and a 7⁄10 chance otherwise. dNetHack also introduces [Kiku-ichimonji](/wiki/Kiku-ichimonji "Kiku-ichimonji"), an artifact katana that replaces Snickersnee (which is changed to a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife")) as the Samurai's first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift").

A blessed +3 katana [named](/wiki/Name "Name") Sasuke's Blade can be found in the hidden westernmost room of the Fire Temple within the [Chaos Temple Quest](/wiki/Chaos_Temple_Quest "Chaos Temple Quest").

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [extraplanar merchants](/wiki/Extraplanar_merchant "Extraplanar merchant") have a chance of generating with a katana.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the katana has a base [object material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(EvilHack\) "Object materials (EvilHack)") of steel. [Ronin](/wiki/Ronin "Ronin") that appear on the Samurai quest have a 3⁄4 chance of generating with a katana.

A katana can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining two long swords, and a katana can be combined with a [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword") to create a [tsurugi](/wiki/Tsurugi "Tsurugi").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), [Nightingale](/wiki/Nightingale "Nightingale") is an artifact katana that is the guaranteed first sacrifice gift for the revived [Ninja](/wiki/Ninja_\(role\) "Ninja (role)") role. Kiku-ichimonji retains its role from dNetHack as the Samurai's first sacrifice gift, and Snickersnee is still present.

## Encyclopedia entry

The katana is a long, single-edged samurai sword with a  
slightly curved blade. Its long handle is designed to allow  
it to be wielded with either one or two hands.
